wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement News Roundup 9/4/2015
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top employee engagement articles from around the industry to keep you informed and inspire positive impact in your organization.

Rethinking Work

Nine out of 10 workers spend half their waking lives doing things they don’t really want to do in places they don’t particularly want to be. We have created a culture where the assumption is we work because we have to, not because we want to. So what do employees want? Barry Schwartz talks us through the history of work and how we can create a new culture that inspires meaningful work and engages everyone.

At Last, a Business Case for CSR That Even Milton Friedman Could Love: The Sustainability Effect!

Top Management is quickly realizing how important Sustainable Reporting can be to the reputation and value of their companies. And we’re not just talking about increased revenues or lower costs here. Strong sustainability performance enhances corporate reputations; and strong corporate reputations, in turn, drive higher market values. The added value from reporting rewards companies for their CSR and sustainability programs. The author includes detailed research on CSR performance, management implications, and explains a new way of accounting.

Why Your Employees’ Suggestions Aren’t Going Anywhere

Companies are always interested in hearing what their employees have to say, but when there is no direction there is no clear path to making improvements. This company changed the function of the suggestion box to become a solution box, based around addressing pressing issues within the company. The company called upon specific people to share their responses, generating more productive and thoughtful solutions while engaging their employees in an entirely new way.

6 Keys to Employee Engagement During Times of Distraction

Distractions are all around us, especially in the workplace. Gallup concluded that 71 percent of all employees are either “not engaged” or “actively disengaged.” In simple terms, most workers are producing far less than they were capable of producing. Don’t worry, there is a solution: Six key components to help ensure you stay actively engaged and successful while at work. Our favorites include: recognize disengagement, keep employees informed, and instill a sense of job purpose.

What Is Your ‘Why’? How I Learned to Live My Purpose

Purposeful leaders leverage common purpose to inspire, unify, and drive collective action to achieve their goals and desired outcomes. The key to success is understanding that your PURPOSE shouldn’t differ in your work and your personal life, they should merge to bring deeper meaning to both. Successful leaders know what inspires them to get up every morning. Inspired by Simon Sinek’s concept of the golden circle, the author shares his story on how he found his purpose.
